title: For Sale:  WTS/WTT:  XM607 (M16)
postcontent:
I have an early XM607 reproduction for sale. It is an Essential Arms J-15, converted by Bushmaster. The buttstock was one of WATom's early repro's, and has been retrofitted with a hardened locking tube. The upper was custom built, a Colt (C M stamped) pre-A1 upper with a HEAVY 10" barrel and a fat gas tube, thus not requiring a moderator. It runs flawlessly, and fast--I'm figuring somewhere around 1100rpm. 

There are some scratches and dings on the lower and upper; if you are looking for a safe queen, this is not it. If you want something that looks close to the original, this is more like it. 

It comes with a complete LM7 upper, tuned by Eric, with two 100rd belts and roughly 750 plastic links. Also included will be 25-50 USGI mags (haven't rounded them all up and counted yet) and a Beta mag. The Beta mag has an aluminum tower, cut down from a GI mag, but is not running perfectly yet. 

I am looking at a few different options in sale/trade: 

1.) HK sear with MP5/10 or MP5K clone host. 

2.) M11A1 in .380 with Lage MAX-11 upper and $11k. 

3.) Steyr AUG with registered sear and 9mm conversion kit. 

4.) 1919 shorty with .22 conversion 

5.) $15k 

I have supplied some photos. Excuse the drywall, I am in the middle of renovation. I can take more pictures for those seriously interested. I am in Ohio, and as always, would prefer an Ohio transfer. Please, no tire kickers, and I am not interested in parting it out. 

Nate 
SteyrTMP

title: For Sale:  SPF - LaserMax Guide Rod Laser for Glock 17 22 31 37
postcontent:
Offered for sale is this LaserMax model LMS-1141P laser sight for a Glock 17, 22, 31, or 37 pistol, but it will not fit any of the Gen 4 weapons.  If you don't know about these, take a look at the manufacturer's page, https://www.lasermax.com/ProductDetails/tabid/127/ ProductID/289/lms-1141p/Default.aspx

This device replaces the spring and guide rod below the barrel, so that the laser beam is emitted a small part of an inch below the bore, and exactly aligned.  Switch it on, put the dot on the target, pull the trigger, and watch a hole appear right where the beam was.  It is completely internal, so once installed, the only way you can even see it is the lens right below the barrel.  Won't interfere with a holster, and leaves your accessory rail free for other things.  Installation takes about 20 seconds, no kidding.  Bring yours along and I'll show you how.

The beam "scintillates" so that it is easy to find, and it's bright enough that even in fairly bright sunlight, it's easy to see at the sort of range that you would use a handgun.

This unit comes in the original factory box including instructions, factory check sheet, a few spare parts, and five new batteries (it takes three at a time, so that's one complete set and 2/3 of another), as well as the working set currently installed.

It is used, but you'll only know by me telling you so, and the lube on the recoil springs.  Great addition to your carry weapon – just point & shoot.

$180 cash and it's yours.  I prefer a FTF transaction anywhere in the SA area, but I'll ship it under the right conditions if a local buyer doesn't scoop it up first.  SOLD PENDING PAYMENT

Offered for sale is this LaserMax LMS-1191 laser sight for a Glock 29 or 30 pistol.  It will also fit the SF models, but NOT the Gen 4 Glocks.  If you don't know about these, take a look at the manufacturer's page, https://www.lasermax.com/ProductDetails/tabid/127/ProductID/295/Default.aspx

This device replaces the spring and guide rod below the barrel, so that the laser beam is emitted a small part of an inch below the bore, and exactly aligned.  Switch it on, put the dot on the target, pull the trigger, and watch a hole appear right where the beam was.  It is completely internal, so once installed, the only way you can even see it is the lens right below the barrel. This unit comes in the original factory box including instructions, factory check sheet, a few spare parts, and two complete sets of replacement batteries. title: For Sale:  CAV-15 MKII Complete Polymer Lower - Black
postcontent:
CAV-15 MKII Receivers are injection molded from glass filled nylon 6, a polymer material very similar to that used by Glock, HK, Steyr and other firearms companies. Polymer offers unsurpassed corrosion resistance, finish durability. and is significantly lighter than aluminum based receivers.  

The receivers are molded in two halves and assembled using a vibration welding process.  Vibration welding forms the two halves into one solid piece.  Every contact surface between the two halves is bonded together with a weld that is even stronger than the parent material.

CAV-15 MKII Receiver Features:

A1 Length integral Stock (5/8" shorter than A2) with sling loop

Ergonomically enhanced integral pistol grip

Wider magazine well capable of accepting .45 Greasegun or Thompson magazines with caliber conversion upper receivers and magazine blocks.  Standard AR15 magazines can be used without modifications. 

Receiver weight (complete) is 1 full pound lighter than complete aluminum receiver with A2 stock

Uses all standard mil-spec parts with the exception of the take down pins.  The front pivot and rear pins are a Quick Take down style with Detents built into them, This allows for quick and easy removal of the pins while maintaining a positive lock.

title: For Sale/Trade:  STEEL BOX Outdoor Job Site Tool Storage Box
postcontent:
This is one of those heavy steel outdoor construction site tool boxes that you see all the time. This one was originally sold by Lowe's hardware store under the KOBALT brand name and would make an excellent, low cost alternative secure storage solution for firearms. (Adding your own safe de-humidifier, not included, would be a good idea.)

The outside looks like hell but the inside is in very good condition. I used it to store everything from electronic equipment to small power tools to spray paint cans and various other things you might find in a garage or workshop.

The box has undergone a number of color changes and endured countless rain and snow storms while preserving the interior contents remarkably well. Far better than I ever expected it would.

Originally bought the box new years ago for about $275.00 so they probably cost more new by now. I don't think Lowe's has boxes like this any more but there are a lot of other companies out there making them. The box is secured by using two of your own padlocks which are inserted into each of the two holes you see in the front of the box where they can not be reached by bolt cutters. (Padlocks not included.) 

DIMENTIONS: 2ft. tall, 2ft. deep and 4ft. wide is the main box, not including the steel skids under each end. There is also a 3 1/2 inch steel troft inside.
There is a sticker inside it which says DAWS MFG.
 Part Number 37211296, Model IND48SS

I have multiple online ads so please mention which item you are contacting me about. If you are reading this, the ad is almost certainly still unsold.

Door to door transportation is available with your assistance lifting it into the truck and an extra $2.00 per mile paid in advance.

Asking $180.00 cash or trade for something useful.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Valtro PM5 (Italian box magazine fed pump 12g)
postcontent:
here's a link to the gun's info since i know most folks will be unfamiliar with it.

http://www.valtrousa.com/shotguns.html

i have a Valtro PM5 i'd like to sell for $750 or trade toward items listed below.  this is a very hard to come by gun in the US as they were only imported for a short time.  i've seen listings on gun broker and guns america for this gun ranging from $1k used to $1600 new, however, these listings are few and far between.  

the good-

this is an Italian made box magazine fed pump action 12 gauge.  it has an aluminum alloy receiver making it very light.  also the ammo all being directly under the receiver makes for a very well balanced gun.  you don't get that nose heavy feeling like you do with tube magazine fed guns with this kind of round capacity.  also the pump action is extremely smooth.  the magazine spring takes the place of the shell lifter making the forward motion of the forearm just as light as the backward motion.  it is truly a world of difference between your typical mossberg 500 or remington 870 type pumps.   the round capacity on this gun is 7+1. 

the bad-

the guns previous owner obviously didnt appreciate what a fine firearm this is and scratched up the barrel pretty noticeably.  not deep gouges or anything, just the black matte finish is scratched off and you can see shiny metal underneath.  this is a shooter, not a safe queen.  thus the much lower price than you see other places online.

i love this gun and i hate to sell it, but i bought a 930 auto loader and i really only need 1 home defense type shotgun.

will trade for the following with +/- cash where necessary

AK 47/74  
30-06 rifle (remington, savage, winchester, etc)
AR15 or AR10
handguns in .45acp or 9mm only, specifically, 1911's, SIG's, HK's, XD's or XDm's, possibly others.  no glocks or taurus's, and no junk guns like hi point, bersa, etc.
ammo in .45acp, .223, 5.56, or 12g buckshot/slugs

i MIGHT be willing to trade for something i didn't list here.  if you think you have something i might like just shoot me an email.

postcontent: Pair of Remington Model 700s both in .223 Remington.  One is a 700 Tactical, 20” 1:9 twist barrel.  Purchased new 2/2/12. It has Leupold Mark 4 2 piece bases and Maxima quick release scope rings in medium height.  All finishes are matte black.  I have original box and paperwork.  No defects and as new.  The other is a Remington Model 700 .223 BDL Custom Deluxe, 24” 1:12 twist barrel, with a Leupold VX-IIc 3-9x40mm scope with Butler Creek flip open lens covers in Leupold low rings on Leupold 2 piece bases. The rear site has been turned around to accommodate the scope. The gun is in good condition with a few handling marks. There are a few smudges in the clear coat on the stock and there are a few imperfections in the blueing on the barrel. No pits or rust on any of the metal though. The scope glass is perfect but there are some scratches on the scope body. The bore is in excellent shape and the muzzle crown is perfect. The trigger has been adjusted and is very light and crisp. I loaded some 52 gr. Sierra MatchKings seated 2.2” over 26.5 gr. of Hodgdon 4895 in Federal Gold Medal Brass with Federal Gold Medal primers. I shot a five shot group from a cold clean bore. I had the usual cold, unfouled bore shot that was 1/2" from the rest of the group. The other 4 shots were easily covered by a quarter. The next 5 shot group was the same except the cold bore shot was not as far from the rest of the group. I was shooting prone with a bipod and monopod at 100 yards with both rifles. title: For Sale:  Dublin Castel Brown Bess
postcontent:
I recently came into an old musket that has a manufacturer of Dublin Castel. I think it maybe what they call a Brown Bess.  It was pulled out of a basement in CT and there is no question in my mind that it is original. Plus you couldn’t make a replica this rough. The pieces for the most part are all there but the trigger guard does not appear to be the original as it does not properly fit in the cut out of the stock.   The only things I believe to be missing are a few screws.  You can pull back the firing mechanism and it does work (so the spring is not broken) There does not appear to be any rifling in the barrel, if there was it is rusted away or covered with dirt. The stock is cracked and it needs to be glued back together. 


I have no idea of its value and if it’s worth something I will most likely sell it, if it is of little value I will clean it up (cannot ruin a antique of little value) and put it over my fireplace.  So, if you are interested make me an offer on it. If you have questions, what more photos etc. please let me know.

title: For Sale:  NIB LWRC M6-SL Piston AR-15 5.56mm 16.1" Barrel AR AR15
postcontent:
This is a Factory New In the Box LWRC M6-SL(Stretch-Lightweight) Semi-Auto, Piston Driven AR-15 in 5.56mm with a 16" barrel and a 30 round Magpul PMAG. CODE: M6R5B16SL Caliber: 5.56 Finish: Black Barrel: 16” Light Contour Cold hammer Forged Nicorr Barrel 1:7 twist Piston: Stretch Piston System Sights: A2 front sight, Daniel Defense A1.5 rear sight Carrier: Nickel Boron One Piece carrier WEIGHT (unloaded): 6.44 lbs (over 1 pound lighter than the M6A2) Bolt: nickel ACB FCG: Enhanced Nickel Fire Control Group Handguard: Magpul Mid-length (Piston) MOE handguard Stock: MOE Grip: MOE FACTORY DESCRIPTION : The new M6-SL is a replacement of our base model M6 rifle of old. The SL, which stands for 'stretch-lightweight', incoroprates everything a shooter needs in a quality light-weight base model rifle. Price and weight were the most important factors when developing the SL. With the M6-SL, LWRCI has brought to the market the lightest factory piston driven rifle to date. The SL comes standard with Magpul furniture. A MOE mid-length handguard, MOE Stock, and MOE pistol grip provide excellent handling characteristics, while minimizing added weight. The SL utilizes the 'stretch' or mid-length piston system, providing a more direct recoil impulse for faster follow-up shots. The most distinct feature of the SL is the barrel. The barrel still utilizes LWRCI's NiCorr surface conversion technology on a cold-hammer-forged barrel, but the barrel is of a smaller diameter to reduce weight. The SL comes standard with the EXO (nickel-boron) plated Advanced Combat Bolt, one piece EXO coated carrier, and the EXO coated enhanced fire control group. The SL also comes standard with a Daniel Defense A1.5 fixed rear sight and a fixed A2 front sight post. The SL is a great addition to the LWRCI family of rifles. It provides users with an extremely lightweight rifle that incorporates our patented short-stroke piston operating system, has all of the advanced coatings that make our rifles the best in the world, and does so at an entry level price.

title: For Sale:  (3) antique German 1888 Commission rifles 8mm .318" & .323" bores
postcontent: SELLING my small collection of German 1888 Commission rifles.  All 3 are chambered in 8mm 8x57.  The short one is completely numbers matching down to the action screws, barrel and stock has been shortened, and still has the original .318" diameter bore size.  The next one is in completely original configuration and numbers matching, except for the bolt face parts.  The bolt head, extractor, ejector, and firing pin were replaced.  That one is an original German "S" conversion, re-rifled to .323" bore to fire the modern 8x57 round, in the early 1900's.  The last one was a Gew. 88 made in Germany, that was sold to the Turks, and modernized by the Turks to 1938 M38 specs. It had the barrel changed to a K98 8mm barrel, and K98 type stock with bolt disassembly socket in the stock.   I have fired the last one and it's a tack driver.  All 3 have EXCELLENT bores.   These are nice guns, and would make a good addition to any beginners gun collection.  Price is $700 and I will ship. Although all 3 technically qualify as antiques, being pre-1899 makes, they can and will shoot modern 8x57 ammo. So these must ship to an FFL.  If you live in Pa., you can legally purchase them direct, with proof of residency and age i.d. card, i.e. picture drivers license.  $700 takes them but I would accept offers.  That is a good price, only $233 per gun.

title: For Sale:  Husqvarna HVA lightweight model 4000 rifle, 1640 action 30-06 w/scope, sling
postcontent: selling off my spare deer rifles.  This is a vintage Husqvarna Lightweight model 4000 rifle,  made in Sweden using a small ring Mauser type short action.  It is made using what was then called a 1640 action.  Very light and handy.  Nice checkered walnut wood stock, vintage scope, with sling. Very accurate.  No open sights as it came from Husqvarna.   Hinged floorplate to dump shells and unload magazine.  Crisp trigger, very accurate, light gun.  Can carry around with one hand while hunting.  Very good condition.  Husqvarna lettering script address on barrel.  HUSQVARNA stopped making guns in 1972 so this is a collectible sure to appreciate with time.   Swedish steel barrel.  Will ship for $35 to your FFL or C&R, or sell direct in person if you have a valid Pa. drivers license picture i.d.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sako A7 270 Winchester
postcontent:
This gun fire honest  1/2 to 3/4 of an inch groups   at 100 yards.Sako guarantees 5 shots under an inch at 100 yards. The trigger is adjustable, the bolt is incredibly smooth, the mag comes out of the gun for easy loading/unloading.

 Scope mounts come with this gun.The scope is NOT included in this price. This gun bridges the gap between a Tikka T3 Lite and a Sako 75/85. It is a relatively light gun and has an aftermarket Limbsaver  recoil pad. This would make an excellent deer gun or even elk if shooting the right bullets. The barrel is blued and the stock is synthetic. $550 I believe they are running over $750 plus new. 

I have approximately 50 rounds thru this gun. Wether or not you buy into ythe barrel break in philosophy.This gun had a proper barrel break in.
I painted the stock.The stock was removed prior to painting. Yes I know you may or may not like it:) LOL But the gun is a shooter. I would be open to trades preferably Glocks Springfield xd or xdm or a sig. Let me know what you have.
Thanks for looking.

Bill
REDACTED

title: For Sale:  Cuddeback Deer Trail Cams - LAST ONE MUST GO!!!!!!!!
postcontent: ONLY ONE CUDDEBACK LEFT AND IT MUST GO! $125 (plus shipping if necessary) takes it.There are nothing wrong with any of these and all have actually been used within the last 2 months and work great. The only reason I'm selling these are because I have multiples of all of them and am trying to get rid of a few of my multiples so I can hopefully pick up a few of the new Plotwatcher Pro cams to add to my scouting arsenal.The first 2 up for sale are Cuddeback Captures. These are simply the best cameras I have used to date. The trigger speed on Cuddebacks are faster than any other and it really shows, more deer in the center of the shot and less missed. They are both still in great condition and last really long on batteries even set at the shortest 30 second intervals. Both still have the mounting straps which work quite well because they can be tightened to almost any size tree. These cost me $230 plus tax a piece new, I'm looking to get $150 each for these.The only trades I would really be interested in at the time is things that go bang, Cuddeback Attack IR, or possibly other high end name brand hunting items. But would prefer to sale to get the Plotwatchers. Any interest please email me, thanks for your interest.

Marlin 308 bolt action

I am also selling it with the scope.It has a Mueller 3-10X40 illuminated reticle scope on it.
